_readme: MCP Configuration for GitHub Copilot Coding Agent
HOW TO USE THIS FILE:
1. Copy ONLY the 'mcpServers' section below (without this _readme block)
2. Go to: Repository Settings → Copilot → Coding agent → MCP configuration
3. Paste and save
The coding agent does NOT read this file directly - it only reads from
the GitHub settings UI. This file exists for version control and reference.
WHAT'S NOT INCLUDED (already built-in to GitHub Coding Agent)
- github-mcp-server: Built-in with read-only access to current repo
- fetch/web access: Agent has firewalled internet access already
- filesystem: Agent runs in ephemeral Actions environment
SERVER DESCRIPTIONS
MEMORY
Persistent key-value storage across sessions. Agents can remember
project conventions, decisions, and context. Note: persistence may
be limited depending on how/where the agent runs.
CONTEXT7
Fetches current documentation for libraries (rasterio, geopandas,
polars, torch, etc.) directly from source, rather than relying on
potentially stale training data. Critical for fast-evolving libraries.
